channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Fires 17 Inspectors General in Late-Night Purge
item.description: The internal government watchdogs were believed to have been dismissed at several major agencies, though the Justice Department’s was not said to have...

item.title: 4 best supplements for an energy boost, according to experts
item.description: Sometimes caffeine just doesn’t do the trick.

item.title: President Trump shrugs off Elon Musk’s criticism of $500 billion Stargate plan: ‘He hates one of the people’
item.description: Musk’s shots at Stargate are the latest development in a yearslong feud with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.

item.title: Crypto czar David Sacks says NFTs and memecoins are collectibles, not securities
item.description: Sacks likened Trump’s recently-released memecoin to ‘a baseball card or a stamp.’

item.title: Nancy Leftenant-Colon, 104, Dies; Army Nurse Broke a Color Barrier
item.description: After years of being barred from a segregated military, she became the first Black nurse in the regular U.S. armed forces. She was later an Air Force ...

item.title: Myanmar Rebels Are Opening Colleges
item.description: As Myanmar’s civil war heads into a fifth year, anti-junta forces are opening universities and colleges as part of their pursuit of a federal democrac...

item.title: Adults with ADHD have a shorter life expectancy, study finds
item.description: The findings are “extremely concerning,” the scientists said. The increased risk may stem from a tendency toward harmful activities and a lack of heal...

item.title: Arthur Blessitt, Who Carried a Cross Around the World, Dies at 84
item.description: A street preacher from Hollywood, he set out on a walk to New York City in 1969 with a 110-pound cross on his back. Then he kept going.

item.title: Donald Trump promised to tackle cost-of-living crisis—now he’s risking inflation by demanding interest rates drop ‘immediately’
item.description: Progress reducing the rise in consumer prices has stalled, with recent data coming in hotter than expected. By pressuring the Federal Reserve, Trump c...

item.title: What Elon Musk’s Salute Was All About
item.description: A gesture associated with the Nazis has a surprising history. But in Germany, there was little doubt about its meaning.

item.title: In China, Rare Dissent Over a Program to Save on Drug Costs
item.description: Top doctors raised concerns about domestically made drugs, saying Beijing’s effort to lower costs is sacrificing quality.

item.title: Myanmar Rebels Are Opening Colleges
item.description: As Myanmar’s civil war heads into a fifth year, anti-junta forces are opening universities and colleges as part of their pursuit of a federal democrac...

item.title: Trump Says He Will Reach Out to North Korean Leader Kim Jong-un
item.description: North Korea’s leader has grown more assertive since their last efforts at diplomacy ended in failure — and now has Russia at his side.

item.title: Israel Says UNRWA Has 6 Days to Halt Operations in East Jerusalem
item.description: The directive came in a letter to the U.N., after the Israeli Parliament banned the relief agency that has aided Palestinian refugees for decades.

item.title: Hegseth Is Second Cabinet Secretary to Need Tiebreaker Vote, After DeVos
item.description: In 2017, Betsy DeVos barely survived her confirmation vote to become President Trump’s secretary of education.
